verses.kjv: And the fifth angel sounded, and I saw a star fall from heaven unto the earth: and to him was given the key of the bottomless pit.
verses.web: The fifth angel sounded, and I saw a star from the sky which had fallen to the earth. The key to the pit of the abyss was given to him.
verses.ct: The 5th angel blew his trumpet, and I saw a star that had fallen from heaven to the earth. This star was given the key to the bottomless pit.

verses.kjv: And he opened the bottomless pit; and there arose a smoke out of the pit, as the smoke of a great furnace; and the sun and the air were darkened by reason of the smoke of the pit.
verses.web: He opened the pit of the abyss, and smoke went up out of the pit, like the smoke from a burning furnace. The sun and the air were darkened because of the smoke from the pit.
verses.ct: He opened the bottomless pit, and smoke billowed up from it like smoke from a massive furnace. The sun and the sky went dark because of the smoke pouring out of the pit.

verses.kjv: And there came out of the smoke locusts upon the earth: and unto them was given power, as the scorpions of the earth have power.
verses.web: Then out of the smoke came locusts on the earth, and power was given to them, as the scorpions of the earth have power.
verses.ct: Out of the smoke came locusts that swarmed across the earth, and they were given power like the stinging power of scorpions.

verses.kjv: And it was commanded them that they should not hurt the grass of the earth, neither any green thing, neither any tree; but only those men which have not the seal of God in their foreheads.
verses.web: They were told that they should not hurt the grass of the earth, neither any green thing, neither any tree, but only those people who don’t have God’s seal on their foreheads.
verses.ct: They were told not to harm the grass, any green plant, or any tree — only the people who didn't have God's seal on their foreheads.

verses.kjv: And to them it was given that they should not kill them, but that they should be tormented five months: and their torment was as the torment of a scorpion, when he striketh a man.
verses.web: They were given power, not to kill them, but to torment them for five months. Their torment was like the torment of a scorpion when it strikes a person.
verses.ct: The locusts weren't allowed to kill these people, but they could torment them for 5 months. The pain they inflicted was like the agony of a scorpion's sting.

verses.kjv: And in those days shall men seek death, and shall not find it; and shall desire to die, and death shall flee from them.
verses.web: In those days people will seek death, and will in no way find it. They will desire to die, and death will flee from them.
verses.ct: During those days, people will desperately search for death but won't find it. They'll long to die, but death will escape them.

verses.kjv: And the shapes of the locusts were like unto horses prepared unto battle; and on their heads were as it were crowns like gold, and their faces were as the faces of men.
verses.web: The shapes of the locusts were like horses prepared for war. On their heads were something like golden crowns, and their faces were like people’s faces.
verses.ct: The locusts looked like horses armored for battle. On their heads sat something like golden crowns, and their faces resembled human faces.

verses.kjv: And they had hair as the hair of women, and their teeth were as the teeth of lions.
verses.web: They had hair like women’s hair, and their teeth were like those of lions.
verses.ct: They had hair like a woman's hair, and their teeth were like a lion's fangs.

verses.kjv: And they had breastplates, as it were breastplates of iron; and the sound of their wings was as the sound of chariots of many horses running to battle.
verses.web: They had breastplates, like breastplates of iron. The sound of their wings was like the sound of chariots, or of many horses rushing to war.
verses.ct: They wore breastplates that looked like iron armor, and the roar of their wings sounded like an army of chariots and horses charging into battle.

verses.kjv: And they had tails like unto scorpions, and there were stings in their tails: and their power was to hurt men five months.
verses.web: They have tails like those of scorpions, and stings. In their tails they have power to harm men for five months.
verses.ct: They had tails like scorpions, complete with stingers, and with those tails they had the power to torment people for 5 months.

verses.kjv: And they had a king over them, which is the angel of the bottomless pit, whose name in the Hebrew tongue is Abaddon, but in the Greek tongue hath his name Apollyon.
verses.web: They have over them as king the angel of the abyss. His name in Hebrew is “Abaddon”, but in Greek, he has the name “Apollyon”.
verses.ct: Their king was the angel of the bottomless pit. His name in Hebrew is Abaddon, and in Greek he is called Apollyon.

verses.kjv: One woe is past; and, behold, there come two woes more hereafter.
verses.web: The first woe is past. Behold, there are still two woes coming after this.
verses.ct: The first woe has passed. But two more are still coming.

verses.kjv: And the sixth angel sounded, and I heard a voice from the four horns of the golden altar which is before God,
verses.web: The sixth angel sounded. I heard a voice from the horns of the golden altar which is before God,
verses.ct: The 6th angel blew his trumpet, and I heard a voice coming from the 4 horns of the golden altar that stands before God.

verses.kjv: Saying to the sixth angel which had the trumpet, Loose the four angels which are bound in the great river Euphrates.
verses.web: saying to the sixth angel who had the trumpet, “Free the four angels who are bound at the great river Euphrates!”
verses.ct: The voice said to the 6th angel who held the trumpet, "Release the 4 angels who are bound at the great river Euphrates!"

verses.kjv: And the four angels were loosed, which were prepared for an hour, and a day, and a month, and a year, for to slay the third part of men.
verses.web: The four angels were freed who had been prepared for that hour and day and month and year, so that they might kill one third of mankind.
verses.ct: So the 4 angels were released — they had been held ready for this exact hour, day, month, and year — to kill a third of all humanity.

verses.kjv: And the number of the army of the horsemen were two hundred thousand thousand: and I heard the number of them.
verses.web: The number of the armies of the horsemen was two hundred million. I heard the number of them.
verses.ct: The mounted army numbered 200 million. I heard the count announced.

verses.kjv: And thus I saw the horses in the vision, and them that sat on them, having breastplates of fire, and of jacinth, and brimstone: and the heads of the horses were as the heads of lions; and out of their mouths issued fire and smoke and brimstone.
verses.web: Thus I saw the horses in the vision, and those who sat on them, having breastplates of fiery red, hyacinth blue, and sulfur yellow; and the horses’ heads resembled lions’ heads. Out of their mouths proceed fire, smoke, and sulfur.
verses.ct: In my vision, I saw the horses and their riders. The riders wore breastplates colored fiery red, deep blue, and sulfur yellow. The horses' heads looked like lions' heads, and fire, smoke, and brimstone poured from their mouths.

verses.kjv: By these three was the third part of men killed, by the fire, and by the smoke, and by the brimstone, which issued out of their mouths.
verses.web: By these three plagues were one third of mankind killed: by the fire, the smoke, and the sulfur, which proceeded out of their mouths.
verses.ct: A third of humanity was killed by these 3 plagues — the fire, the smoke, and the brimstone that blasted from the horses' mouths.

verses.kjv: For their power is in their mouth, and in their tails: for their tails were like unto serpents, and had heads, and with them they do hurt.
verses.web: For the power of the horses is in their mouths and in their tails. For their tails are like serpents, and have heads, and with them they harm.
verses.ct: The horses' deadly power was in both their mouths and their tails. Their tails were like serpents with heads, and they used them to inflict harm.

verses.kjv: And the rest of the men which were not killed by these plagues yet repented not of the works of their hands, that they should not worship devils, and idols of gold, and silver, and brass, and stone, and of wood: which neither can see, nor hear, nor walk:
verses.web: The rest of mankind, who were not killed with these plagues, didn’t repent of the works of their hands, that they wouldn’t worship demons, and the idols of gold, and of silver, and of brass, and of stone, and of wood; which can’t see, hear, or walk.
verses.ct: Yet the rest of humanity — those who survived these plagues — still didn't repent of what they had made with their own hands. They kept worshiping demons and idols crafted from gold, silver, bronze, stone, and wood — things that can't see, hear, or walk.

verses.kjv: Neither repented they of their murders, nor of their sorceries, nor of their fornication, nor of their thefts.
verses.web: They didn’t repent of their murders, their sorceries, their sexual immorality, or their thefts.
verses.ct: They refused to repent of their murders, their sorceries, their sexual sin, or their thefts.
